meanings.definition: The area behind the stage in a theater.
meanings.sent1: Actors often gather in the backstages before going on stage.
meanings.sent2: The crew worked tirelessly in the backstages to set up the props.
meanings.sent3: In a play about a magical forest, the backstages were filled with fake trees and fairy lights.
meanings.sent4: The backstages of life reveal the true efforts behind every successful performance.
meanings.sent5: The backstages buzzed with excitement as the actors prepared for the grand finale.

meanings.definition: The private area where performers prepare for a show.
meanings.sent1: Singers often warm up their voices in the backstages before a concert.
meanings.sent2: Dancers hurriedly changed costumes in the backstages between acts.
meanings.sent3: The backstages turned into a mini fashion show as actors tried on different outfits.
meanings.sent4: In the backstages of a circus, the performers transformed into magical characters.
meanings.sent5: The backstages echoed with laughter and chatter as the cast got ready for the performance.

meanings.definition: The hidden or unseen aspects of a situation or event.
meanings.sent1: She always tried to uncover the backstages of people's motivations.
meanings.sent2: The backstages of the negotiation revealed surprising details.
meanings.sent3: His detective work focused on exploring the backstages of the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The backstages of politics can be more intriguing than the public speeches.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the backstages of history gives a deeper insight into past events.
